info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 6 at 1:45AM EDT until May 6 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Buffalo NY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. The gauge at DSVN6 on the Canaseraga Creek peaked at 8.36 feet at 11:15 PM this past evening. The level is falling, however still remains well above normal. Emergency management and law enforcement reported the river level running high on the creek. At this time, impacts are minimal, however flooding is expected along the creek due to readings well above normal.
* WHERE...A portion of western New York, including the following county, Livingston.
* WHEN...Until 445 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 139 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area, including along the Canaseraga Creek and its tributaries. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dansville and Groveland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
